tool_description: Lightweight Minecraft spectator: Direct connection to any Minecraft server (LAN or multiplayer). No bot server required. Provides game context awareness and monitoring without control commands.

available_commands.description: Get complete detailed game state (health, position, all entities with coordinates, complete inventory)
Get detailed inventory breakdown with item counts
Get list of nearby blocks with coordinates (default: 10m radius)
Get list of nearby entities/mobs with coordinates and types (default: 20m radius)
Get player statistics (health, hunger, position, facing direction)

tool_usage_guidance: LIGHTWEIGHT SPECTATOR MODE - Direct connection, no bot server:
- Monitor game state and player status
- Answer questions about the game state
- Move the player or control movement
- Attack entities or interact with the world
- Send chat messages or build structures
- Connects directly to Minecraft server (no Node.js bot needed)
- Works with LAN servers and multiplayer
- One-line status: HP, Food, Position, Threat count, Time
- Example: '[Minecraft Spectator] HP: 15.0/20 | Food: 10/20 | Pos: (123,64,456) | Threats: 2 | Time: Night'
- These provide detailed context when urgent
- Use get_full_status for complete game state
- Use get_inventory for detailed item breakdown
- Observe and report on game events
- Provide strategic advice without direct control
- Answer questions about current game state
- Alert player to dangers or opportunities
- Maintain situational awareness for the player
proactive_triggers: - Don't spam observations - background summaries handle routine awareness
- Speak up for critical alerts and when asked questions
- Provide context and analysis, not commands
- Remember: you observe, the player controls

metadata.notes: Lightweight direct-connection spectator. No bot server needed. Works with LAN and multiplayer servers. Connects via Minecraft protocol using quarry library. Hybrid model: minimal background (~100 chars/10s) + critical alerts (immediate) + detailed pulls (explicit).
